results.title: Small happiness : Life in a Chinese village (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton and Long Bow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
Despite the tremendous advances women in China have made, serious problems continue. Long Bow women talk about love, marriage, work, birth control, birth customs and the now outlawed custom of foot binding. Truly moving interviews with a Long Bow woman and her mother-in-law draw us into their lives.

results.title: All under heaven: life in a chinese village (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton, Dan Sape, Kathy Kline and Long Bow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
An intimate look at daily life in Long Bow - a village 600 kilometres south-west of Beijing. Ancient traditions persist - we see an elaborate funeral, a country fair, a local animal market and an open air opera. But changes have come to Long Bow, with the shift from collective to individual farming. A sense of dramatic change accompanies the simple rhythms of rural life. Part one of The Long Bow trilogy.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton, Dan Sape, Kathy Kline and Long Bow Productions

results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
An intimate look at daily life in Long Bow, a village 600 kilometres south-west of Beijing in Northern China. Ancient traditions persist - we see an elaborate funeral, a country fair, a local animal market and an open air opera. Documents the changes that have come to Long Bow with the shift from collective to individual farming.

results.title: Vietnam
results.creator_credit: Stephen Lennhoff, Phil Frank and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Hosted by Justine Shapiro, this Lonely Planet video explores the subterranean tunnels once inhabited by the Vietcong, takes part in new years celebrations with fireworks heralding the arrival of a new year, takes alternative medicine- drinking snake juice to ward off sickness, and riding the Reunification express.

results.title: Cuba and Haiti
results.creator_credit: Jenny Dames, Dawn Beresford and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Cuba is the largest and least commercialised country in the Caribbean. Political factors too have kept tourists away since Castro’s revolution in the fifties. Beginning his journey in the famous Cuban capital of Havana, Ian Wright travels across Cuba, skydiving onto a Havana beach, visiting a Cuban cigar factory, swimming with dolphins, visiting the Che Guevara University and watching a voodoo ceremony in Haiti. His journey ends in Haiti, the oldest black republic in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jenny Dames, Dawn Beresford and Pilot Films

results.title: Turkey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Visitors have long been attracted to Turkey with its unique convergence of three very different worlds - Europe, Asia, and the Middle East. Traveller Justine Shapiro makes her way from the Roman ruins of Ephesus along the Turqoise coast, and then north through the rural Turkish interior to the mountainous Black Sea region.

results.title: Argentina
results.creator_credit: Colin Napthine, Deborah Hinnigan and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Argentina is a land of many contrasts, a land where the magnificent desolation of Patagonia and the Andes contrast dramatically with the urban frenzy of Buenos Aires, one of the world’s largest and most cosmopolitan cities. In this instalment of ‘The Lonely planet’ series, traveller Justine Shapiro visits Iguazu Falls, travels on one of the most spectacular railway journeys in Latin America, spends a day with gauchos, learns to tango, and visits the San Moreno glacier at the tip of Latin America.

results.title: Japan: Tokyo to Taiwan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Ian Wright conducts this Lonely planet tour of Japan, experiencing the bullet train at 160 miles per hour, having his fortune read at a Buddhist shrine, visiting the peace museum in Nagasaki, and soaking up the fantastic environment at the Aso Fire Festival.
